member.name: P:SharpGLTF.BaseBuilder.Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets the display text name, or null.
⚠️ DO NOT USE AS AN OBJECT ID ⚠️ see remarks.
member.remarks:
glTF does not define any rule for object names.
This means that names can be null or non unique.
So don't use for anything other than object name display.
If you need to reference objects by some ID, use lookup tables instead.

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.BaseBuilder.Extras
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom data of this object.

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Collections.ValueListSet`1
member.summary: Represents A specialised list that requires all elements to be unique.
member.remarks:
- This collection is based on - Replaces - Designed to work with lists of vertices.
This collection is: - like a HashSet, in the sense that every element must be unique. - like a list, because elements can be accessed by index: . - and are fast as in a HashSet.
member.typeparam: Any value type.

member.summary: Represent an ordered collection of vertices, where every vertex is unique.
member.typeparam: A Vertex type

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Geometry.MorphTargetBuilder`4
member.summary: Represents the vertex deltas of a specific morph target.
member.typeparam: The material type used by the base mesh.
The vertex geometry type used by the base mesh.
The vertex skinning type used by the base mesh.
The vertex material type used by the base mesh.
member.remarks: Morph targets are stored separately on each , so connecting vertices between two primitives might be duplicated. This means that when we set a displaced vertex, we must be sure we do so for all instances we can find.

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Geometry.VertexBufferColumns
member.summary: Represents a vertex buffer, where every vertex attribute is represented as a vector column.
member.remarks: One of the use cases of is to bind the different attribute columns directly to the source feed, which means that if you modify the contents of a column that is bound directly to a model, you're modifying the model's internal data.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.Geometry.VertexBufferColumns.IsolateColumns
member.summary: Performs an in-place copy of the contents of every column, which guarantees that the columns of this are not shared by any other object and can be modified safely.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.Geometry.VertexBufferColumns._ApplyTransform(SharpGLTF.Transforms.IGeometryTransform)
member.summary: Applies a transform to the columns of this
member.remarks: This is a one time operation. Once it's applied, skinning and morphing columns are removed, since they're baked into the position, normal and tangent columns.

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.IO.WavefrontWriter
member.summary: Tiny wavefront object writer
member.remarks: Wavefront obj export is not intended to be a fully featured wavefront / converter exporter, but to serve as support and reference for glTF development. Consider this feature as an "easter egg".

member.name: F:SharpGLTF.IO.WavefrontWriter.FILEENCODING
member.summary: As per Wikipedia , the content of the file should be ASCII

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.IO.WavefrontWriter.WriteFiles(System.String)
member.summary:
Writes this model to two files:
- filePath.OBJ
- filePath.MTL
member.remarks: The extension of is discarded and replaced by .OBJ and .MTL when required.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.IO.WavefrontWriter.GetFiles(System.String)
member.summary:
Serializes this model to a dictionary with 2 entries:
- ("baseName.OBJ", Byte[])
- ("baseName.MTL", Byte[])
member.remarks: The extension of is discarded and replaced by .OBJ and .MTL when required.

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.InstanceBuilder.Name
member.summary:
Gets the display text name of this object, or null.
⚠️ DO NOT USE AS AN OBJECT ID ⚠️ see remarks.
member.remarks:
glTF does not define any rule for object names.
This means that names can be null or non unique.
So don't use names for anything other than object name display.
If you need to reference objects by some ID, use lookup tables instead.

member.summary: Gets the custom data of this object.

member.summary: Gets the materials used by .

member.name: T:SharpGLTF.Scenes.LightBuilder
member.summary: Represents the base class light object.
member.remarks:
Derived types are:
-
-
-

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.LightBuilder.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the RGB value for light's color in linear space.

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.LightBuilder.Intensity
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Brightness of light in.
The units that this is defined in depend on the type of light.
Point and spot lights use luminous intensity in candela (lm/sr) while directional lights use illuminance in lux (lm/m2)

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.LightBuilder.Point.Range
member.summary:
Gets or sets a Hint defining a distance cutoff at which the light's intensity may be considered to have reached zero.
Supported only for point and spot lights. Must be > 0.
When undefined, range is assumed to be infinite.

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.LightBuilder.Spot.Range
member.summary:
Gets or sets a Hint defining a distance cutoff at which the light's intensity may be considered to have reached zero.
Supported only for point and spot lights. Must be > 0.
When undefined, range is assumed to be infinite.

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.LightBuilder.Spot.InnerConeAngle
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Angle, in radians, from centre of spotlight where falloff begins.
Must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than outerConeAngle.

member.name: P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.LightBuilder.Spot.OuterConeAngle
member.summary:
Gets or sets Angle, in radians, from centre of spotlight where falloff ends.
Must be greater than innerConeAngle and less than or equal to PI / 2.0.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.Scenes.SceneBuilder.FindArmatures
member.summary: Gets all the unique armatures used by this .
member.returns: A collection of objects representing the root of each armature.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.Scenes.SceneBuilder.ApplyBasisTransform(System.Numerics.Matrix4x4,System.String)
member.summary: Applies a tranform the this .
member.param: The name of the dummy root node.

remarks.para:
In some circunstances, it's not possible to apply the to the nodes in the scene.
In these cases a dummy node is created, and these nodes are made children of this dummy node.
This method is useful to switch axes (Z-UP or Y-UP) and left right handed mode.
This method should be called at the end, when the scene has been created completely.

member.summary: Copies the instances from to this
member.param: A transform to apply to before addition.

P:SharpGLTF.Scenes.SceneBuilderSchema2Settings.GpuMeshInstancingMinCount
member.summary: determines the mínimum number mesh instances required to enable Gpu mesh instancing.

remarks.para: Set to to disable gpu instancing.
If set to a small value like 10, any mesh instance collection smaller than this will be instantiated using individual nodes, otherwise it will use Gpu Instancing extension.

member.summary: Sets the cone angles for the light.
member.param: Gets the Angle, in radians, from centre of spotlight where falloff begins. Must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than outerConeAngle.
Gets Angle, in radians, from centre of spotlight where falloff ends. Must be greater than innerConeAngle and less than or equal to PI / 2.0.

member.name: M:SharpGLTF.Schema2.Toolkit.WithColor(SharpGLTF.Schema2.PunctualLight,System.Numerics.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Defines the light color, intensity and range for the current .
member.param: RGB value for light's color in linear space.

Brightness of light in. The units that this is defined in depend on the type of light. point and spot lights use luminous intensity in candela (lm/sr) while directional lights use illuminance in lux (lm/m2)

Hint defining a distance cutoff at which the light's intensity may be considered to have reached zero. Supported only for point and spot lights. Must be > 0. When undefined, range is assumed to be infinite.
